item.description:
Saturday May 30th (New Day)
Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary
TC: Richard Kline email: r_kline@verizon.net or 978 535-1903
EVENT: Ipswich River, Mass Audubonâ€™s largest sanctuary, offers more than 10 miles
of interconnecting trails that invite you to explore the forests, meadows, and wetlands.
Climb the drumlin and esker, landscape features created by a glacier 15,000 years ago.
Huge rocks and exotic trees and shrubs that were part of a former arboretum provide an
adventurous walk along the Rockery Trail.
MEET: 11:00 AM in the sanctuary parking lot located at 87 Perkins Row, Topsfield, MA
From Boston and the south: Take Rt I-95 north to exit 50 and follow Rt 1 North. At the junction
of Rt 1 and Rt 97, turn right onto Rt 97S (toward Beverly and Danvers). Follow Rt 97S and
take the 3rd left onto Perkins Row. Follow Perkins for 1 Mile and the Sanctuary is on the right.

From the North: Take Rt I-95 South to exit 53A and follow Rt 97 South. At the junction of Rt 1 and
Rt 97 in Topsfield, stay on Rt 97 South and take the third left onto Perkins Row. Follow Perkins
Row for 1 mile, and the sanctuary is on the right.

COST: $4 for nonmember adult Audubon entrance fee; $3 for nonmember children (2-12) plus
$5 if not a member of Mosaic.
item.how_to_find_us: Contact Richard : r_kline@verizon.net or 978 535-1903 to make the arrangements

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary
